Emily Bielejec

Syracuse, NY
emily.bielejec@gmail.com

"It is our goal as an ever-changing system to implement and sustain programs that reach all of our students."

I am a Special Education Teacher in the Syracuse City School District and have just completed my CAS. When I'm not at school, I enjoy hiking with my husband and 3 dogs, tending to my bee hives and eating local food.

Education & Skills

Administrative Intern

Public Service Leadership Academy at Fowler High School, Syracuse, NY
  • Analysis and creation of 2020-2021 Master Schedule
  • Advise Administrative Team on graduation options for students with disabilities
  • Organize PSAT/SAT and Regents Testing for all students
2019 - 2020

Administrative Intern

Special Education Summer School, Syracuse, NY
  • Collaborate and work with team of 3 to lead K-12 Building
  • Hired Staff (25 Teachers, 150 Teaching Assistants)
  • Coordinate daily transportation K-12
Summer 2019

Special Education Teacher

Public Service Leadership Academy at Fowler High School, Syracuse, NY
  • Assist students in obtaining Career Development and Occupational Studies credential
  • Interview potential student candidates for academy enrollment
  • Implement a six week personalized learning classroom environment for students with disabilities during summer school
2015 - Present

Experiences & Understanding

"Ensuring core values, communication, relationships, prioritization, organization and flexibility are at the forefront of decisions and creating a shared vision; transformative leaders must remember to be human. Effective leaders must be willing to open up to others, to show others who they really are, and use effective communication."

"Effective leaders will set the foundation for successful change, but require the continued support of teachers, staff, students, and community members."

Platform Statements

Data Driven Leadership

"Effective leaders must hold themselves accountable in order to improve student achievement. Instructional leaders need to be able to understand data, set realistic goals, create and collaborate on methods of improvement, as well as continuing to check for development. Successful leaders identify and implement individualized professional growth plans. These plans based off observations, consist of collecting data during instructional time, digesting the data, and collaborating on it with the teacher."

Observation Reports

District Project

"The objective of the Work Based Learning Revamp was to increase the number of different site opportunities for students with disabilities within the Syracuse City School District. This project also required insurance considerations to create an improved permission slip as well as training teaching assistants supervising and interacting with students on work sites."

Reflection

"I have always worked towards bettering the opportunities for students with disabilities, and in doing so have learned a lot about procedures, policies, and programs available to students. While completing my CAS, I have committed my time to working with other teachers, support staff, and administrators to help students with disabilities any way that I can."

"As I move forward, I would love to continue to work as a Special Education teacher with a cohesive collaborative team providing the best education for all students. I am currently in the planning stages of pursuing a lifelong dream of opening a working farm for students with disabilities. The variety of experiences I was fortunate to be a part of during my CAS helped to shape the community member I intend to be in the community I serve and the path I want to forge moving ahead."
